page.title: 19Housing.
page.content: Stalyhill.- Housing. Old Houses in the area were called 'folds', and were built as farms in the form of a square to protect animals. Luke's fold and Tong's fold are now very expensive, converted houses. Nailor's, Higher and Lower Arpley are still working farms. Nailors has been farmed by the Thompson family for almost 100 years. The Farm is dated 1738, but the back of the house is very old, and has beams from ships. Mamy of the modern houses have two bathrooms and nearly all are two car families. The houses are brick built. Many are detached, but there are also semis, and town houses, and bungalows.
